report.title: Galangal Experiments
report.author: Various
report.bodytext: From: John Anderson /n Newsgroups: alt.drugs /n Subject: Galanga Injestion /n Date: Nov 1993 /n /n > I eat galanga all the time. I was first introduced to it when I started /n > getting into Thai cooking. Galanga (also called 'Laos') is used /n > extensively as a spice throughout Tropical Asia. /n > /n > Forget the dried or powdered stuff, get fresh! It is available in Asian /n > grocerys all over Dallas, so it can't be that hard to come by. It looks /n > much like ginger with a translucent skin. It costs around 2.50 to 6.00 /n > dollars a pound, and that goes a LONG way - it's potent! /n > /n > I often make a spicy chicken soup, and through in about 10 slices of the /n > fresh stuff (the receipe calls for 5). It's DEFINITELY psychoactive! I /n > experience quite a buzz within 10 minutes of finishing a bowl. I agree, /n > it's somewhat like marijuana - but I really like it. I make the soup /n > often for friends and all have experienced the buzz - some quite /n > intensely. /n /n Excellent, thanks for the tip. I had some last night in my rice, but I didn't use quite enough for the effects to be noticable. For me it takes about two heaped tablespoons to get the effect. (into a cup of rice) Unfortunately any more than this and it gets too strong to eat! /n /n > If anyone's interested, I post the receipe (apart from the psychoactive /n > properties it's quite delicious!) /n /n Yes do that! I'm sure there would be heaps of interested parties, including myself /n /n > One final note: I have found other interesting things in Asian grocery > stores, like betel nuts (including FRESH frozen ones at one store), > assorted inhalents, and bizzare bottled herb & vitamin drinks. /n /n Inhalents?? interesting, I have noticed all the herb drinks but never thought much about them. Ever tried any? /n /n The inhalents are not as exciting. They're all pungent smelling concoctions based on volatile oils like camphor or eucalyptus. /n /n Like I said, I'll post the galanga soup reciepe as soon as I get a chance to dig it up. There's also a file on galanga at ftp.hmc.edu. /n /n ========================================================================= /n /n From: Kenneth23 /n Newsgroups: alt.drugs /n Subject: Re: Galanga experiments /n Date: Feb 1995 /n /n Well, I don't know about brands, but fresh galanga is absolutely DELICIOUS in south-east asian cooking! I once had a Thai friend make me a sort of white curry with chicken and galanga. There wasn't much -- mabye a few 4'x2' slices in the entire (large) curry pot, so I didn't get any sort of 'high.' The flavor, though, was fantastic when cooked, vaguely gingery, yet distinctly different. /n /n ========================================================================= /n /n From: Bruce Dale /n Newsgroups: alt.drugs,alt.psychoactives /n Subject: Re: Galanga experiments /n Date: Feb 1995 /n /n Gees yeah /n /n I also was very inspired by the galanga.rpts @ hyperreal.com's archives [http://www.erowid.org/herbs/galangal/] and followed what the instructions on what appears to be 'a modern legend' - that is two teaspoons of dried galanga(l)/laos powder and felt zilch !! /n /n Tried 4 teaspoons in orange juice 3 days later and still nothing. !! /n /n Had much better luck with Guarana... /n /n Might stick to the real stuff in future !! /n /n ========================================================================= /n /n From: Tommy the Tourist /n Newsgroups: alt.drugs,alt.psychoactives /n Subject: Galanga -Forget it! /n Date: Mar 1995 /n /n I posted a few weeks ago about my experiments with galanga. At that time I had tried both powder and dried roots with no psychoaactive effects whatsoever. Last night I found fresh roots at the local Middle Eastern grocery. I bought about 10oz of roots that slightly resembled small onions with tops. I trimmed off the green shoots saving 8 1-1.5' diameter roots about 2' long. Probably 8oz of solid roots total. I put them in a blender with 24oz of V8 juice and blended until smooth. The mixture wasn't quite as foul as the powder or the ground, dried root, but it was still pretty unpleasant. I waited 20 minutes between halves to let my stomach recover. No psychoactive effects within 3hrs so I went to bed. A minor case of the trots the next morning for all of my efforts. No more galanga for me.
